profileAlternative.name: Mark Chamness
profileAlternative.headline: Director, Data Science & Machine Learning at Coursera
profileAlternative.summary:
Chamness leads the Data Science and Machine Learning team. He received his B.S. in Physics from the California Institute of Technology and M.S. in Statistics from San Jose State University. He was a Ph.D. Physics candidate at Brown University where he conducted research in machine learning under Nobel Laureate, Leon Cooper. His undergrad advisor was Nobel Laureate, David Politzer. Mr. Chamness has been a consultant on machine learning for Sun Microsystems, Visa, and Stanford University.

Chamness has 17 granted patents on Machine Learning and has published in leading journals.

He was a Ph.D. Physics candidate at Brown University where he conducted research in machine learning under Nobel Laureate, Leon Cooper. His undergrad advisor was Nobel Laureate, David Politzer. Mr. Chamness has been a consultant on machine learning for Sun Microsystems, Visa, and Stanford University.

Chamness has 17 granted patents on Machine Learning and has published in leading journals.

items: Automated identification of the source of RAID performance degradation
Capacity forecasting for a deduplicating storage system
Method and apparatus for predicting potential replication performance degradation
Method for prediction of the duration of garbage collection for backup storage systems
Automated defect diagnosis from machine diagnostic data
Method and apparatus for automatically detecting replication performance degradation
RAIDShield: Characterizing, Monitoring, and Proactively Protecting Against Disk Failures
Characteristics of Backup Workloads in Production Systems
Capacity forecasting in a backup storage environment
What makes good wine? The dirt on terroir
Performance Tuning for the JDBC API

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Head of Data Science at Coursera
Assistant Professor of Economics, Wake Forest University
